page.title: 18TRAFFIC SURVEY IN TILE HILL
page.content: We did a traffic survey of the traffic which uses the three main roads in Tile Hill Village. Our survey was done in three separate groups in the afternoon. There were exactly the same number of buses in Station Avenue as in Tile Hill Lane but as this part of Torrington Avenue is not a bus route we did not see any buses. There were very similar numbers of cars, vans, lorries and motorcycles in these first two streets as these are the two routes which carry traffic from Coventry, through Tile Hill Village, towards Kenilworth. Torrington Avenue is much busier in the mornings and in late afternoons than the rest of the day as there are many small industrial units along this street. There were more pedestrians on Tile Hill Lane but we discovered that they were going to a mother and baby clinic that day!
